;

;;17 parcels of land purchased 7 years ago at a cost of 8.525 billion yuan, after 6 years of development It was discovered that 14 pieces of land were seriously polluted. A lawsuit announcement by Shanghai Lujiazui Financial and Trade Zone Development Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Lujiazui") on November 4 aroused heated discussions among netizens. ;;;

;

;;This incident is not a simple dispute between companies. As more details were revealed, the case quickly became a hot topic on November 8. ;

;

;;

;

;;There are three main points that make the majority of netizens "eat melons":;

;

;;First, Lujiazui sued five units, among which the most Involving Jiangsu government departments. Lujiazui disclosed in the announcement that due to soil pollution problems, its subsidiaries have transferred Jiangsu Suzhou Iron and Steel Group Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "Suzhou Iron and Steel Group"), Suzhou Environmental Science Institute, Suzhou Suzhou Environmental Technology Co., Ltd., Suzhou National The High-tech Industrial Development Zone Management Committee and the Suzhou Municipal Natural Resources and Planning Bureau went to court and recently received a written case acceptance notice from the Jiangsu Provincial Higher People's Court;;

;

;;The second is Lujiazui’s claim amount is as high as 10 billion yuan. According to industry estimates, the litigation costs of this lawsuit may be as high as 50 million yuan;;

;

;;Third, 14 cases of seriously contaminated land have attracted market attention . The land purchased in Lujiazui was purchased in 2016, but the contaminated land was not discovered until 2022. By this time, a large number of businesses had been built. Did the pollutants affect the construction workers? Why has no problem of excessive pollution been found during construction site operations for 6 years? Have you tried other options before filing a lawsuit? Wait for questions to follow;;. ;

;

;
;;On the afternoon of November 8, the Securities Affairs Department of Lujiazui Company responded to Nandu Bay Financial News: "We have disclosed all matters related to soil pollution disputes in the announcement. , are not accepting interviews at the moment. Regarding the status of the projects such as the Reading School that have been delivered, from the perspective of disclosure, we do not need to disclose it. We will make an announcement if there is any progress in the follow-up matter." Nanduwan Financial Society also called the above five defendants, but As of press time, the call had not been connected. ;

;

;;Many industry insiders told reporters from Wancaishe that complex interests are involved behind the "poisonous land", and the relevant departments of the Shanghai and Jiangsu governments should handle related issues rationally and prevent produce sequelae. ;

;

;;;After spending 8.5 billion in 222 rounds of bidding, ;;;;Lujiazui bought 14 “poisonous sites”? ;;

;

;;The incident originated from Lujiazui’s strategic decision to “go global” 7 years ago. ;

;

;;In 2016, Lujiazui’s designated holding subsidiaries Jiawan Company and Jiaer Company (through a trust plan) formed a consortium and jointly bid for the listing of Suzhou Iron and Steel Group Co., Ltd. on the Shanghai United Equity Exchange. 95% of the equity of Green'an Company was transferred. The main assets under the name of Green'an Company are 17 land use rights located north of Sutong Road and east of Sugang Road in Suzhou High-tech Zone. ;

;

;;

;

;;The development history of Suzhou Iron and Steel Group. Source: Suzhou Iron and Steel Group official website. ;

;

;;According to public reports at the time, this equity auction attracted more than 30 interested investors, with a total of 19 companies participating. After 222 rounds of bidding, it attracted Greenland, Poly , Shimao, Vanke, China Merchants and many other real estate companies participated in the bidding. ;

;

;;Lujiazui finally won 95% of the equity of Suzhou Green Bank Real Estate Development Co., Ltd. for a total price of 8.525 billion yuan (transaction price of 6.84 billion yuan, debt of 1.685 billion yuan). ;

;

;;Lujiazui, which has defeated many powerful real estate companies, is also quite confident about the success of this auction. At that time, the group publicly stated that the successful joint bid for 95% of the shares of Suzhou Green Bank would be conducive to further increasing the company's land reserves and expanding the company's development space. "By actively implementing the 'going global' strategy, we will further enhance the brand influence of Lujiazui commercial real estate and enhance The company's sustainable operating ability and profitability.";

;

;;However, Lujiazui's bold "going out" investment decision was not so smooth sailing. ;

;

;;In 2021, news spread that Suzhou Green Bank accidentally discovered that some plots of the project had serious pollution risks, and a report was made to the local government departments. ;

;

;;In April 2022, the "Processing Status of the Sixth Batch of Letters and Calls Transferred to Our Province by the Second Central Ecological and Environmental Protection Inspection Team" announced on the official website of the Jiangsu Provincial People's Government mentioned Recently, the test results of a third-party testing agency showed that benzopyrene and naphthalene in the soil of many plots of the Suzhou Green Bank project seriously exceeded the standards and did not meet the land use standards. ;

;

;;It also mentioned that the Suzhou High-tech Zone Management Committee attached great importance to it, established a special work team, and quickly started work, requiring Suzhou Green Bank to effectively perform its main responsibilities. Before the end of June, a third-party agency will be entrusted to complete the formulation of a soil pollution investigation plan, and the organization and implementation will be organized and implemented. Related work will be carried out in accordance with the law based on the investigation results. During this period, the above-mentioned plots shall not carry out any activities unrelated to the prevention and control of soil pollution. ;

;

;;In the same month, Lujiazui also issued an announcement stating that 8 of the 17 plots of land have been developed. It was unexpectedly discovered that plots 2 and 13 where educational facilities have been built and plots 3 and 4 that have not been developed yet have serious pollution risks. Many elements in the soil or groundwater greatly exceed the standards and do not meet the original requirements of these plots. According to the planned land use standards, the total area of ​​the four plots is approximately 118,000 square meters. As of the end of 2021, the cumulative project investment in the four plots is approximately 450 million yuan;;. ;

;

;;Due to the exposure of land pollution problems, the Lujiazui project had to be stopped. ;Public information shows that the above-mentioned land No. 2 and land No. 13, where the pollution was determined, are planned to build Suzhou Reading School and a kindergarten respectively. ;When they were named by the Central Second Ecological Environmental Protection Inspection Group in 2022, the two plots of land had been completed. According to media reports, due to pollution problems, Suzhou Reading School failed to welcome its first batch of new students in September 2021 as scheduled, and the students of the school are transitioning to Suzhou Science and Technology City Foreign Language School. ;

;

;;

;

;;Aerial view of Suzhou Reading School. Source: Suzhou Reading School official website. ;

;

;;The announcement pointed out that the company organized a special force to verify and found that during the regulation adjustment and transfer process of Su Di No. 2008-G-6 plot, Suzhou Iron and Steel Group, the environment The testing agency and others are suspected of a series of violations, fraud, etc., which may have caused severely polluted land to enter the public trading market, and they concealed relevant information when listing and transferring 95% of Suzhou Green Bank's shares. ;

;

;;;If the land pollution identification is falsified, may the defendant face triple risks?;; ;;;;

;

;;In 2023, Lujiazui took the relevant parties to court. On November 4, it announced in an announcement that the court had filed the case. Accept relevant cases. ;

;

;;

;

;;Picture from Lujiazui official website;

;

;;In the context of relevant cases , Lujiazui said that since 2022, environmental investigations by the company and all parties have determined that 14 pieces of land under the name of Green Bank Company are polluted, and the polluted area and degree of pollution far exceed the pollution conditions disclosed by Suzhou Iron and Steel Group when it was listed for sale. ;

;

;;At the same time, the company entrusted a professional agency to verify and found that during the process of regulation adjustment and transfer of the land involved in the case, the defendants committed a series of violations, committed fraud, and failed to perform their duties in accordance with the law. The infringements together resulted in the plaintiff receiving the land involved in the case that was seriously polluted. ;

;

;;Lujiazui requested that the defendant be ordered to pay compensation of RMB 10.044 billion to the plaintiff (if it is subsequently discovered or clear that the actual amount is higher than this amount, the lawsuit will be increased or a separate lawsuit will be filed) Responsibility; request a ruling to order defendants 2, 3, 4 and 5 to bear joint and several liability for the claim in item 1; request a ruling to order that the litigation costs of this case shall be jointly borne by all defendants. ;

;

;;This lawsuit with a claim amount of up to 10 billion yuan quickly aroused heated discussion in the market. According to estimates by industry insiders, based on a fee of 0.5%, the litigation costs in Lujiazui may exceed 50 million. ;

;

;;

;

;
;;As for the reason why Lujiazui sued for large compensation, Wang Yuchen, director of Beijing Jinliu Law Firm, told reporters that the main reason is that it may face pollution problems on the land where the construction project is located. Huge legal risks and legal liabilities, and the Suzhou Iron and Steel Group, appraisal institutions, etc. in this incident will also have corresponding legal risks and legal liabilities. ;

;

;;It further stated that as far as Lujiazui Group is concerned, according to the current information, it has a large scale of construction, many types of projects, and a huge amount of capital investment in the land involved in the case. , and related projects were found to have serious pollution in the land during construction, completion, sales and other aspects. Construction suspension, completion acceptance failure, sales suspension, rectification and repair, re-appraisal, etc. are all problems that Lujiazui Group is currently facing or will need to face in the future. Behind this, only in terms of civil liability, there is the risk of breach of contract in various contracts such as construction contracts signed with construction units and house purchase contracts signed with owners. ;

;

;;;A claim of 10 billion yuan, what is the probability of winning? ;;

;

;;Wang Yuchen told reporters that if Suzhou Iron and Steel Group knew about the land contamination of the relevant land parcels at the time of the transfer and had the obligation to know but failed to perform it, it would Intentional concealment, etc. may not only affect the validity of the previous contract, but also face corresponding liability for breach of contract. For the losses that Lujiazui Group needs to bear, Lujiazui Group also has the right to recover from Suzhou Iron and Steel Group; in addition, if the appraisal agency investigates the case There are cases of fraudulent identification involving soil pollution, and they also face legal risks and liabilities. ;

;

;;First, it will involve civil compensation risks, and may bear joint liability with Suzhou Steel and other entities; ;
;;Second, it will face administrative The risk of punishment is that you may face administrative penalties such as warnings, fines, confiscation of illegal income, and revocation of corresponding qualifications;;
;;Third, if the circumstances are serious, the relevant responsible personnel may also be guilty of providing false certification documents, etc. Criminal offenses, criminal liability. ;

;

;;Zhou Zhengfeng, a lawyer at Guangdong Huashang Law Firm, also told reporters that if the investigation proves that the soil pollution involved in the case was falsified, Lujiazui may win the case. But the case may eventually be mediated. ;

;

;;Of course, in addition to the current lawsuit, this case will also require corresponding solutions in the future. Issues such as how to deal with developed land are more worthy of attention. ;

;

;;;Lujiazui behind the “poisonous land” case:;;Revenue and net profit dropped;;

;

;;In addition to paying attention to the case itself, the incident also caused netizens to worry about Lujiazui’s business conditions. ;

;

;;As of November 8, Lujiazui’s market value was 44.76 billion yuan. Perhaps due to the huge impact of the case, the company’s stock price fell 0.75% that day to 9.30 yuan per share. ;

;

;;“You can’t recover the cost even if you win the lawsuit” “The claim amount of 10 billion is equivalent to 22% of the market value” “Is there no money for development?” Some investors responded to the incident They have a negative attitude, believing that Lujiazui is also facing operating difficulties during the real estate downturn cycle; but some netizens also have a positive attitude, "Lujiazui's attitude is not bad. Investors are more assured when such things happen, and proactive disclosure of information makes investors feel more at ease." "Lujiazui still has a conscience. No more false reports were issued to defraud property owners into purchasing their homes.” ;

;

;; Regarding whether the case will have an impact on the company’s operations, Lujiazui mentioned in an announcement on November 4 that the case is still in the filing and acceptance stage, and it is temporarily unable to judge whether it will affect the company’s operations. The impact on the company’s profits for the current period or subsequent periods. According to relevant media reports, Lujiazui Chairman Xu Erjin said at the performance briefing on November 6 that the company’s special working group is going all out to carry out disposal and rights protection work, and promote relevant responsible parties to assume subsequent disposal responsibilities. ;

;

;;Xu Erjin also emphasized at the performance meeting that in the future, the company will pay close attention to the market situation in the Yangtze River Delta, choose opportunities to participate, continue to actively support the integrated development and construction of the Yangtze River Delta, and continue to strengthen Optimize the company's main business. ;

;

;;Although the company still has confidence in investment, it is undeniable that from the data point of view, Lujiazui has experienced a continuous double decline in operating income and net profit. According to the financial report, in 2022, Lujiazui achieved revenue of 11.762 billion yuan, a year-on-year decrease of 15.21%; net profit was 1.085 billion yuan, a year-on-year decrease of 74.84%; revenue in the first three quarters of 2023 was approximately 5.775 billion yuan, a year-on-year decrease of 14.48%; attributable to listing The company's shareholders' net profit was approximately 837 million yuan, a year-on-year decrease of 27.75%. ;

;

;;The decline in Lujiazui’s performance is not unrelated to the fact that the current real estate market is still at a trough. In the first three quarters of this year, the national real estate development investment was 8,726.9 billion yuan, a year-on-year decrease of 9.1%; the commercial housing sales area was 848.06 million square meters, a year-on-year decrease of 7.5%. ;

;

;;“Land pollution has devalued, the real estate market has declined, and forced development is unprofitable.” Some people in the industry believe that the main reason for this case to surface is due to multiple factors Impact. ;

;

;;The emergence of this case also triggered a new round of discussion on land development in the real estate industry. "In the past 20 years of working in the industry, I have never seen a lawsuit like the tens of billions of land withdrawals due to soil pollution." Zhang Hongwei, founder of Jingjian Consulting, said that the lawsuit has involved the two governments, so it is not easy to handle. However, the "poisonous land" has been delayed for seven years. It is hoped that through the coordination of relevant departments in Shanghai and Jiangsu, this problem can be fundamentally solved. ;

;

;;Yan Yuejin, research director of Yiju Research Institute, speculated that the case may also involve fraud and corruption, which obviously requires strict investigation. "This incident also shows that in some years of radical real estate development, some land transfers did not follow the regulations and were transferred illegally, which caused many problems and infringed on the legitimate rights and interests of the people." ;

;Mother's magic shoes. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;Earlier, I was talking about that before she got sick, she wore the Leviathan sold by Azhen Pei magic shoes. In fact, she was already feeling uncomfortable at that time. She was lethargic, had diarrhea and had a fever. Maybe cancer cells were growing wildly in her body, but no one knew it.

;

;She said they were a pair of magical shoes. A pair sells for MYR 2,200. Azhen allowed her to take the shoes home first and try them on for a while before paying. She was satisfied, and perhaps felt she had taken advantage.

;

;So she wore them out, to breakfast in town, to the store, and to her son's wedding in Taiwan.

;

;"I almost fell!" she once said to me. I don’t know whether it was because she was too weak at the time, or whether the shoes made her feet uncomfortable.

;

;I never cared about those shoes. It was a place where people would believe in porcupine dates, talisman water and head-dropping magic. A pair of shoes is no big deal.

;

;But those are no ordinary shoes. Azhen said that they were energy health shoes with super magnets. The soles of the shoes contained carefully blended Chinese medicine, which could open the second heart of the human body and stimulate the body's self-healing energy ring.

;

;"Health comes from wearing it", it says on the paper bag of the shoes.

;

;By the time I saw those shoes, she was already a skinny, spiteful patient. She began to resent the shoes.

;

;Paradoxically, her friend Xiuli also suffers from cancer. But Xiuli didn't wear magic shoes. She ate the collagen powder sold by Azhen. They both eat it every day. That thing is quite troublesome, you have to eat it as soon as you get up, and the sooner you eat it, the better. Once, when we were traveling to Xi'an, she got up before dawn to boil water and make collagen powder. After drinking it, she went back to bed to sleep. The buzzing sound from the hotel kettle made my second sister and I upset.

;

;She didn’t want to see the pair of shoes, so she asked my sister and I to go to Azhen’s barber shop to return the shoes. She went to get a haircut that day, but she didn't go to Azhen's barber shop, nor to Alian's barber shop downstairs. She held an umbrella alone and walked to the barber shop upstairs in the back shop.

;

;My sister and I bravely walked into Azhen’s barber shop. Azhen was perming a woman's hair while talking to us. She showed us her and her daughter's shoes. They all wore black leather shoes that were exactly the same as their mother’s pair of Allipex magic shoes.

;

;"Look, my daughter and I wear them. I stand and work all day long, and my feet are not sore at all!" Azhen said.

;

;Of course the shoes cannot be returned. "Who would buy it after they've already been worn?" Azhen rejected us.

;

;A few days later, Xia Mu came to Ula Port, and his mother showed him the shoes.

;

;"I tell you how these shoes are deceiving, you write it down and publish it in your newspaper." She said to Xia Mu.

;

;Natsuki and I looked at each other, then took a look at the dull, ugly shoes.

;

;This is what she thinks writers and journalists should do. She can’t seem to tell the difference between a reporter and a writer. In her opinion, they are all scholars and writers, and they should use their pens to speak out for others and plead for the people.

;

;"I tell you, you write it down." That's what she said when she told me about her experience of nearly losing her life giving birth to her son.

;

;She herself is such a person, keen on upholding justice and speaking for others, which is completely opposite to her husband.

;

;For a period of time, in addition to working in the tailor shop, she was also busy applying for relief funds for the poor people passing through Hong Kong. She took a stack of application forms from the city council and distributed them to those who were struggling. When she met people who didn't know Malay, she asked her Malay friends to help fill out the forms because she didn't know much Malay herself.

;

;She also called the newspaper office and applied for the newspaper office’s relief fund for her friend.

;

;When she told me this, I was amazed at her ability and passion. I remembered something she said a long time ago. She said a fortune teller had predicted that if she continued to go to school, she would become a big shot like Li Jinshi. Li Jinshi was our former Minister of Health.

;

;She is very proud. She walked around Port Ula like a country squire, like a big shot.

;

;Soon her glory disappeared. She resented the magic shoes, resented her sister, and resented the person who deceived her.

;

;The night before the first chemotherapy session, in a hotel near the hospital, in the early hours of the morning, after vomiting out all her dinner, she told me a story about a woman. The woman received relief funds through her help, but she discovered that she was not poor. She and her husband ran a seafood business in a town not far from the port of Ula.

;

;"I still have their business cards." She said. She decided to call the newspaper to expose the woman.

;

;In less than a month, she herself became a person waiting for relief.

;

;My father said that she could apply for relief and that she should receive relief. So the city council came. The man was also my mother’s friend, and he had been handling the application forms submitted on my mother’s behalf.

;

;Azmin looked at his mother with deep understanding and compassion. He made an immediate decision and suggested that I take a photo of my mother. The mother had to lie in bed so that her illness could be fully revealed.

;

;I did not take pictures of my mother. Xia Mu also did not write a report for her to expose the scam.

;

;It was much later, five years after her death, that I thought I should search the Internet for introductions or news about magic shoes. I soon saw the report in Southern Metropolis Daily.

;

;That was a report in 2016. She wasn't sick yet. I was still teaching in school at that time. Two years later, I was no longer a teacher and she was a dying patient.

;

;When she showed us those shoes, why didn’t we think of searching online? Isn’t this the instinct and ability of us scholars?

;

;Maybe I don’t care how much she spent on a pair of shoes. Maybe I was already used to the fact that she was being fooled. It was a place where people believed in porcupine dates, talisman water and head-dropping magic.

;

;I respect other people’s beliefs and lives, I always say this.

;

;I have left Ula Port for a long time.

;

;"We don't need relief." We kids all thought so.

;

;I did not take pictures of my mother. Besides, my mother was unwilling to lie on the bed and let someone take a photo of her shame and despair.

;

;After her death, one Sunday afternoon, the second sister returned the pair of magic shoes to Azhen. She used the silk money she received from the funeral to pay Ah Zhen 2,200 ringgit.

;

;After she died, I found a newspaper clipping in her drawer. That was the news about the "Love in the World" child sponsorship program in Sin Chew Daily on November 29, 2014. There are portraits of five sixth-grade students on the newspaper clipping. The title of the report is "Repaying Sponsors with Good Results, Sin Chew Sponsored Students Achieve Excellent UPSR Results".

;

;I thought they were all children passing through Hong Kong, children she had helped. no.

;

;I know why she keeps that clipping. She loved stories like this, stories about struggle, hardship and reward, and gratitude. In the past, her children also received support from society with their excellent academic performance. She was proud of it, and she did not blush at all because of the deep aura of humility hidden in it.

;

;That pair of magic shoes may be on a woman's feet right now. We no longer talk about those past events. But I never forgot them.

;

;In the past, I didn’t do what a daughter could (should?) do, so now I do what a writer should do.

;On November 6, the Ministry of Finance issued the "Notice on Typical Cases of Local Government Hidden Debt Accountability", It notified 8 typical cases of hidden debt accountability investigated and dealt with since 2022, involving nearly 46 billion yuan in new hidden debt.

;

;;;

;The targets of this notification involve some local governments, bank branches and state-owned enterprises, including: some areas in Hubei Province require provincial state-owned enterprises to advance capital for construction of new hidden debts, Liuzhou City in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region requires state-owned enterprises Projects with advanced financing for construction should be arranged by the fiscal budget. New hidden debts. Xi'an City, Shaanxi Province, new hidden debts through debt financing of state-owned enterprises. Pengzhou City, Chengdu City, Sichuan Province requires state-owned enterprises to use expected land transfer income as the source of project investment returns. There are new hidden debts in corporate advance construction, etc.

;

;Nanduwan Financial News reporter noticed that in the above-notified cases, it is not uncommon for local governments to require state-owned enterprises to advance funds for construction to increase new hidden debts.

;

;Taking Xi'an, Shaanxi Province as an example, the notice disclosed that from August 2019 to December 2020, according to the decision of the Xi'an Municipal Government's special issue meeting, the construction funds for the Xi'an International Conference Center and other projects were provided by the municipal and district finance bear. Xi'an Expo Investment (Group) Co., Ltd. borrowed 7 billion yuan from five banks including the Shaanxi Provincial Branch of Bank of Communications Co., Ltd. in the name of the construction of three projects including the Xi'an International Convention and Exhibition Center Exhibition Hall. As of the end of June 2021, the actual withdrawals from the project were 6.15 billion yuan, of which 2.6 billion yuan was used for the construction expenditure of the Xi'an International Conference Center project, forming an additional hidden debt of 2.6 billion yuan.

;

;The Shaanxi Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection and the Shaanxi Provincial Supervisory Committee of the Communist Party of China organize to hold relevant responsible persons accountable in accordance with disciplines and regulations. Shangguan, the then mayor of Xi'an, was given an intra-party warning; Li, the then deputy mayor of Xi'an, was criticized and educated, and ordered to make explanations and inspections at the annual democratic life meeting; Chanba Ecology of Xi'an at the time was Men, the director of the district management committee, gave critical education and ordered explanations and inspections at the annual democratic life meeting; Yang, the then director of the Xi'an Finance Bureau, was given an intra-party warning; and Li, the then director of the Xi'an Finance Bureau, was given an intra-party warning. Government demerits were given and other relevant personnel were also dealt with.

;

;Another example is Pengzhou, Chengdu, Sichuan. In January 2021, according to the relevant meeting decisions of the Pengzhou Municipal Party Committee and the Pengzhou Municipal Government, as well as the "Pengzhou Mengyang New City Area Development Investment" issued by the Pengzhou Mengyang New City Construction Leading Group Office Cooperation Implementation Plan", the Pengzhou Municipal Government authorized Pengzhou State-owned Assets Management Co., Ltd. as the comprehensive urban operator of the comprehensive development of Mengyang New City Area to carry out investment, financing, development, construction and operation of infrastructure, real estate development and other projects in the region , and promised to use expected land transfer income as the source of project investment return. As of the end of September 2021, the company had raised a total of 432 million yuan in funds for the construction of the new city area, forming a new hidden debt of 432 million yuan.

;

;The Sichuan Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection and the Sichuan Provincial Supervisory Committee of the Communist Party of China organized and held relevant responsible persons accountable in accordance with disciplines and regulations. The then Pengzhou Municipal Party Committee Secretary Wang Moumou was given admonishment; the then Pengzhou Municipal Party Committee Deputy Secretary and Mayor Chen Moumou was given admonishment; the then Pengzhou Municipal Party Committee Deputy Secretary and the leader of the Mengyang New City Construction Leading Group Zhang Moumou was given admonishment. Warning sanctions; admonition to Hu Moumou, the then deputy mayor of Pengzhou City and deputy leader of the Mengyang New City Construction Leading Group; admonishment to Gong Moumou, the then deputy mayor of Pengzhou City and deputy leader of the Mengyang New City Construction Leading Group ; Give the then Party Secretary and Director of Pengzhou Finance Bureau Zhou Moumou a warning; give the then Pengzhou Municipal Development and Reform Bureau Party Secretary and Director Ma Mou, deputy leader of the Mengyang New City Construction Leading Group, an intra-party warning; The then chairman of Pengzhou State-owned Assets Management Co., Ltd. Qin Moumou was given admonitions; other relevant personnel were also dealt with.
